summary: This is an email chain from June 25, 2019, between FBI personnel discussing coordination for the upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein. It focuses on procedures for compiling and managing victim information from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) into the Victim Notification System (VNS) to ensure victims are notified of their rights.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the email with an NYPD email address, likely involved in FBI-related coordination regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Arrest
events.description: FBI personnel discuss an upcoming arrest (presumably of Jeffrey Epstein) and the need to compile victim information from SDNY into the Victim Notification System to notify victims of their rights.

keyFacts: An email from June 25, 2019, indicates an upcoming arrest related to the Jeffrey Epstein case was imminent.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) planned to issue a press release and an 800 number for victims to self-identify after the arrest.
FBI personnel were coordinating to compile victim information into the Victim Notification System (VNS) to ensure victims were notified of their rights as required by federal law.
The email emphasizes the importance of including full victim/guardian details (name, address, email) for effective notification, especially for minors.
The correspondence highlights inter-agency coordination (FBI/SDNY) and procedural steps for handling victim information in a high-profile case.
